name: Teachings of Conflict
desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Conflict is considered reason in the Nation of Pyro.
Rather than avoiding conflict, one should face confrontations head-on. Once the outcome has been made manifest, the path forward should be determined accordingly.

value.text:
Domain of Mastery: Return <color=#ffe14b>(Wednesday/Saturday/Sunday)</color>
Exchanged in the Gift Shop

customize.name: Varesa
customize.desc: A laid-back orchard manager and warrior of the Collective of Plenty. An aspiring hero who hungers for justice... and lots and lots of food!

customize.name: Chasca
customize.desc: The Peacemaker of the Tlalocan, the ender of all disputes.

customize.name: Ifa
customize.desc: A vet from the Flower-Feather Clan who cherishes the life he leads alongside all manner of living things — people, animals, you name it.

customize.name: Kachina
customize.desc: A young warrior of the Nanatzcayan, given the Ancient Name of "Uthabiti." Kind-hearted and insatiably persistent, she grows stronger and more capable with each setback she faces.

customize.name: Guide to Conflict
customize.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Conflict is considered reason in the Nation of Pyro.
Conflicts can always be resolved by greater powers. This fact means that they can always be managed, as opposed to developing into something uncontrollable. Conflict is also a kind of limitation, preventing people from endless shirking of responsibilities without weighing the costs. It demands that participants settle their scores decisively and efficiently.

customize.name: Mora
customize.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

customize.name: Teachings of Conflict
customize.desc:

Conflict is considered reason in the Nation of Pyro.
Rather than avoiding conflict, one should face confrontations head-on. Once the outcome has been made manifest, the path forward should be determined accordingly.

customize.name: Guide to Conflict
customize.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Conflict is considered reason in the Nation of Pyro.
Conflicts can always be resolved by greater powers. This fact means that they can always be managed, as opposed to developing into something uncontrollable. customize.name: Philosophies of Conflict
customize.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Conflict is considered reason in the Nation of Pyro.
The premise of conflict is that all parties involved must confront their own desires with the utmost sincerity. Only then, amid the fight or debate, can they remain mindful of what they wish to achieve and stay true to their original objectives.
